body:
> On Windows 10 is it still the case that without this call time.Sleep(time.Nanosecond) sleeps for 15 ms?

This https://play.golang.org/p/wLOU7Ah_g7 program prints:
```
C:\>u:\test
[15.6252ms 15.6252ms 15.6252ms 15.6252ms 15.6252ms 15.6252ms 15.6252ms 15.6252ms 15.6252ms 15.6252ms]

C:\>
```
on both my Windows XP 32-bit and Windows 7 64-bit. I don't have Windows 10. But, I believe, @mattn has. @mattn, would you be kind to run program above on your Windows 10? Thank you.

Alex
